Graduate Student Researcher at Broadband Radio Access Technologies Laboratory, University of California, Davis

Davis, CA [ 2011.9 — 2016.1 (expected) ]

Research interests include:

  • Power control and resource allocation algorithm design for heterogeneous networks.
  • Stochastic approximation and its applications in wireless communications.
  • Game theory and its application in wireless communications.
  • Auction / contract design in spectrum trading and other applications in wireless communications.
  • Non-convex and combinatorial optimization in wireless communications.

Interim Engineering Intern at Qualcomm Inc

Santa Clara, CA [ 2014.6 — 2014.9 ]

  • Projected power saving percentage for WCDMA+ using field data.
  • Investigated and implemented in Csim an enhancement to current WCDMA searcher algorithm. Successfully reduced false alarm without harming the detection probability.

System Engineering Intern at Silvus Technologies

San Diego, CA [ 2013.6 — 2013.6 ]

  • Participated in a DARPA project on improving MIMO ad hoc network spectrum efficiency.
  • Designed distributed algorithms combining multiple physical techniques such as joint transmitter and receiver design, link adaptation, power control, etc. for interference mitigation.
  • Jointly considered MAC layer design for the PHY algorithm.
  • Published two conference papers in Milcom 2014.

Teaching Assistant for Course "Electronic Circuits and Systems" at University of California, Davis

Davis, CA [ 2012.1 — 2012.3 ]

Research Assistant at Institute of Statistical Signal Processing (ISSP) at University of Science and Technology of China

Hefei, China [ 2009.1 — 2011.4 ]

  • Developed algorithms for narrow-band signal direction of arrival estimation using array signal processing.
